intro: Ipomopsis arizonica, commonly known as the Arizona larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in desert or semi-desert environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Ipomopsis arizonica is often found in open habitats like grasslands, chaparral, and along streambanks.
